Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; white slip; interior glazed streaky black; traces of added white bands at top and bottom of sherd; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Curator's comments: The lack of decoration on either side of the sherd may be a result of the sherd's size. The decoration on the exterior surface of Simple Animal Style vases is not usually extensive and filling ornament, with the exception of a simple rim pattern, a single elaborate rosette and simple handle zone pattern, is absent. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) have very little decoration as well.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1495) (phase 2)
